lpool.logic.match

Class PlayValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • lpool.logic.match.PlayValidator

  • public class PlayValidator
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for analyzing the legality of a Play and determining whether or not the current player should play again. Some of its methods must be called at the appropriate time so that it knows what events happened and is able to decide accordingly.
    Author:
    Gustavo
    See Also:
    actionBallHit(Ball.Type), actionBorderHit(), actionBallScore(Ball.Type)

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayValidator

        public PlayValidator(boolean openingShot,
                     boolean playerBallsDefined,
                     Ball.Type currentPlayerBalls,
                     Ball[] balls)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        openingShot - Whether or not this is the opening shot.
        playerBallsDefined - Whether or not the balls each player has to score have already been defined.
        currentPlayerBalls - The ball type of the current player or null if not yet defined.
        balls - An array with all the balls (scored or not).

        Method that must be called when the cue ball collides with other ball.

        hitBallType - The type of the ball hit by the cue ball.

        public void actionBorderHit()
        Method that must be called when a ball hits a table bumper.

      • actionBallScore

        public void actionBallScore(Ball.Type scoredBallType)
        Method that must be called when any ball is scored.
        Parameters:
        scoredBallType - The lpool.logic.ball.Ball#Type of the scored ball.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Analyzes the legality of a play according to the game rules.
        Returns:
        True if the play was valid, false otherwise.

      • playsAgain

        public boolean playsAgain()
        Returns:
        Whether or not the current player has the right to play again.
